chapters.name: Daily Use, Charging, and Operational Routines
topics: What typical daily routines will users and service providers follow to keep robotic guide dogs ready for use?
How can charging, docking, and storage workflows be designed to minimize friction for blind users?
What differences in operations arise between personal ownership and shared or pooled service models?
How might usage data inform scheduling, resource allocation, and support staffing over time?

chapters.name: Maintenance, Repair, and Lifecycle Management
topics: What regular maintenance tasks are needed to keep sensors, joints, and electronics functioning reliably in the field?
How can service organizations design repair workflows that minimize downtime for dependent users?
What strategies can extend the useful life of robotic guide dogs while planning for hardware upgrades and obsolescence?
How should spare parts, replacement units, and loaner robots be managed to support a growing user base?

chapters.name: Remote Monitoring, Support, and Updates
topics: What telemetry and health data should be collected to monitor fleets without compromising user privacy?
How can remote support teams intervene safely if they detect anomalies, errors, or unsafe conditions in real time?
What processes ensure that software updates and model retraining are rolled out without disrupting user routines?
How can organizations communicate upcoming changes or new features to blind users in accessible, trustworthy ways?
